required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Impact of a Mobile App on Pregnant Women's Prenatal Genetic Testing Decision-making
clinical_study.official_title: Assessing the Impact of a Mobile App on Pregnant Women's Perceptions, Knowledge, and Uptake of Prenatal Genetic Testing

brief_summary.textblock: Determine the effect of a culturally sensitive prenatal genetic testing (PGT) education intervention delivered via a mobile application on pregnant women's perceptions, knowledge, and uptake of PGT. Our working hypothesis, based on prior studies, is that pregnant women who receive a culturally sensitive intervention to enhance their knowledge and understanding of PGT will feel more confident in their decision-making regarding PGT.

primary_outcome.time_frame: From the time of enrollment to two weeks after the participants' appointment with maternal-fetal medicine specialists.
primary_outcome.description: Measured by a 4-item scale that asks participants how they feel about prenatal genetic testing.

primary_outcome.time_frame: From the time of enrollment to two weeks after the participants' appointment with maternal-fetal medicine specialists.
primary_outcome.description: Measured by 27 knowledge questions about prenatal genetic testing options' timing, procedures, and purposes.

primary_outcome.measure: Decisional conflicts about prenatal genetic testing
primary_outcome.time_frame: From the time of enrollment to two weeks after the participants' appointment with maternal-fetal medicine specialists.
primary_outcome.description: Measured by the modified 5-item SURE Decisional Conflicts scale.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Within one year after the intervention.
primary_outcome.description: Participants' decisions on prenatal genetic testing by reviewing participants' medical charts.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the time of enrollment to two weeks after the participants' appointment with maternal-fetal medicine specialists.
secondary_outcome.description: Measured by the 6-item sub-scale of Brief Symptom Inventory-18 about anxiety.

secondary_outcome.measure: Decision Self-Efficacy about prenatal genetic testing
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the time of enrollment to two weeks after the participants' appointment with maternal-fetal medicine specialists.
secondary_outcome.description: Measured by the modified 11-item Decision Self-Efficacy scale.

secondary_outcome.measure: Preparation for Decision Making about prenatal genetic testing
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the time of enrollment to two weeks after the participants' appointment with maternal-fetal medicine specialists.
secondary_outcome.description: Measured by the modified 7-item Preparation for Decision Making scale.

arm_group.description: This arm will review a mobile app to learn information about prenatal genetic testing before their appointment with maternal-fetal medicine specialists.
This arm will only receive usual care - visit maternal-fetal medicine specialists.

intervention.intervention_name: Mobile app with prenatal genetic testing information
intervention.description: In the intervention group, participants will be asked to download, register, and review a mobile app on their own mobile phones before their appointment with maternal-fetal medicine specialists. This mobile app includes prenatal genetic testing information about amniocentesis, chorionic villus sampling, nuchal translucency screening, cell-free DNA, triple/quad/penta screening, anatomy ultrasound, and carrier screening.
